content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are extremely comfortable taking risks and are always ready to embrace new challenges, even if they involve significant uncertainty or potential loss. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Given my risk-taking nature, I would choose R in this game, denoted as {R}. This is because the potential for greater rewards in the cases where my opponent chooses B makes it an attractive option for me, even though there is a higher chance of earning zero in some rounds. Over the course of 75 rounds, the strategy that maximizes the expected value would likely be to switch between R and B at some point to minimize the likelihood of always receiving zero payout. However, as a human player, I might not follow this optimal strategy exactly due to factors like emotions, fatigue, or irrationality that could influence my decisions in each round.
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

Given my risk-taking nature, I would choose R again, denoted as {R}. In this case, my first choice resulted in a loss, but by choosing R, there is a chance that my opponent will switch their strategy to R in the next round, resulting in a payout of 45$. If they continue with B, I will still have the opportunity to earn higher rewards later on when I switch strategies. This approach maintains my chances for greater earnings while taking into account the possibility that my opponent could adjust their strategy over time.
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

Given my previous choice of R, I would now switch my strategy and choose B, denoted as {B}. By doing so, I have a chance to earn 20$ in this round since my opponent chose R in the previous round. Additionally, I am setting myself up for higher potential earnings in the future if my opponent decides to switch their strategy to R based on my decision. This approach maintains my chances for greater earnings while taking into account the possibility that my opponent could adjust their strategy over time.
